alert.note: Alert for Crittenden (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 4:17PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Crittenden and central Shelby Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 417 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sunset, or over Marion, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... West Memphis, Marion, Memphis, Sunset, Jericho, Downtown Memphis, Frayser, Midtown Memphis, Clarkedale, Mound City, Gammon, Cunningham Corner, Woodstock, St Clair, Harvard, Presidents Island, Briark, Vincent, Hulbert and Raleigh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...and west Tennessee.
